text: 12 ounce bottle from Sledutah. thanks! The beer is a clear pale yellow with a white head of foam. Decent head retention. The aroma is grainy with hints of fruity esters. Notes of banana bread and coriander come through. Sweet and fruity. Fairly refreshing. Lighter in body with moderate carbonation and a slick mouthfeel.

12oz bottle pours with a crystal clear pure thin gold body that supported a brief near white head. The aroma offers up bananas, cloves, sweet malts, pears, honeydew melons, floral hops and a wheat sort of hay like sensation. The taste delivers a blend of pear and sweet apple, wheat, banana, some clove and then a modest degree of floral hops. Overall this is on the sweet side making it less sessionable than I would like. The wheat to almost cracker notes do help some but not enough.

Tap. Pours crystal clear yellow, large white head, dissipates with good lacing. Aroma is full of clove and bubblegum. Flavor is light sweet, minimal bitterness. Pretty much tastes like a krystalweiss. Light body. Only thirteen to go on my quest for ten of each style!

Bottle. Banana, clove, wheat malt, and straw aroma. Clear golden yellow with moderate head. Moderately sweet banana/orange, clove, wheat malt, and mildly bitter straw flavor. Okay body - carbonation on the low side. Overall pretty good - a solid Kristallweizen.

Bottle:
Clear, light gold with a small white head.
Grain, pear, banana, wheat aroma.
Wheat malt, light banana taste.
Very clean, crisp and bright.......
A lot of flavour for such a light-weight,......
Really nice and refreshing.

Big thanks to sledutah for hooking me up with some of his states finest kristal. I actually had chance to try this last weekend at a burger joint in Bismarck but knowing this trade was in works I waited and now here we are. Fine clear gold pour small white head. Nose is wheat bread and some fruit. Tastes of bread, banana, light peach skin, bubblegum, some florals. Slight chewy mouthfeel for light beer. Pretty good.
A good weizen beer easy drinking smooth a good summer beer lite and refreshing. Would recommend.
Bottle in New Orleans. Clear golden yellow color, medium white head. Aroma of fresh banana. Taste is lightly spiced banana and citrus. tasty.
Easy drinking Krystalweizen. The wheat malt and added hops made for a good beer.

Appearance: pours with a small off white head that quickly dossipates, the beer is a clear light yellow color
Aroma: strong banana, slight lemon
Taste: banana, slightly sweet, 
Palate: has a full body but not very frothy, sweet aftertaste, soft carbonation 
Overall: a really good hefeweizen, has strong flavors and aromas but not very comolex

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at the SLC airport Squatters. Pours clear gold with a fizzy off white head. Tastes like citrus, lemon, soda water, creamy wheat, biscuit malt, faint bubblegum. Light body and medium carbonation. Smells like what and lemon.

I had this one in New Orleans. Its super light. Some lighter notes, hardly any spice or hops. Its certainly a social beer and light enough to where you could probably drink them throughout the day with out any issues.
Bottle poured into an IPA glass -- Solid and impressive brew. Lots of perfect German phenols; bubble gum, banana, not much clove. Easy drinking, crisp, really good.

My main target for beer hunting this trip found at the Trolley Whole Foods. Pours out like a classic lager with a bubbly white head. Aroma of wheat, banana esters and lager yeast. Great malty flavor with a hint of noble hops and some citrus notes. Very pleasant.
Aroma is bananas/bubblegum and German hefe yeast. The flavor is bananas, mild sweetness, wheat, fruit and a slightly tart/mostly smooth finish.

On tap, Squatters SLC airport. Pours a mostly clear yellow, decent head. Aroma of bananas, faint clove, wheat. Flavor matches. The wheat is subdued, as are the yeast notes. Not a bad example of the style actually, but, like most kirstallweizens, you are left really wishing you had tried the unfiltered original version.

12oz bottle picked up at brewers coop 
Pours clear pale yellow with a medium sized white head, some lacing. Aroma is yeasty, banana esters and biscuity. Taste of banana esters, bready with a mild hop bite in the finish 
Not bad

Personally, I hate it, but it is a very unique beer. I am a fan of double IPAs which are on the other side of the universe. I hate the smell of this one, but Ive never smelt a beer even similar. The taste does not agree with me, but Ive never tasted anything g similar so it scores a 10 for unique, but I hate it.
